intro: Aegiphila mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian aster, is a flowering plant native to the Brazilian Pantanal region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a distinctive aromatic scent. Aegiphila mattogrossensis is adapted to wetland environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
